thoughts.text: I have found some good resources on kayaking, camping, and hiking locations. I can use the 'write_to_file' command to save this information to a file for future reference.

thoughts.criticism: I need to make sure that I am not just saving information for the sake of saving it. I need to make sure that the information I am saving is relevant to my goal of exploring the world through hiking, camping, and kayaking.

Best Kayak Camping Trips & Places To Go 1. San Juan Islands, Washington 2. Koreshan State Park, Florida 3. Mockhorn Island, Virginia 4. Eleven Point National Scenic River, Missouri 5. Tomoka State Park, Florida 6. Klamath River, California 7. Indian River Canoe Trail, Michigan 8. Brunet Island State Park, Wisconsin 9. Green River, Utah

7 Best Kayak Trips in the U.S. - Travel + Leisure For a full, multiday trip, put in at Churchill Dam and float till you reach Allagash Village, a section that has Class II rapids, lakes, and a short but mandatory portage around the Allagash Falls...

Makena Beach, Maui: spot sea turtles through the clear water Off the shores of Makena Beach, on Maui's southern coastline, is a beautiful kayaking spot. Here, a series of underwater lava formations, created by submarine volcanoes, makes an ideal home for green sea turtles.

How many miles should you cover on your first overnight trip? A lot depends on your kayaking experience. Experienced paddlers might be able to cover 20 miles or more in one day on still water. But us newbies should plan for about 10 miles or less per full day of paddling on still water.

Chesapeake Bay The Chesapeake Bay is the largest estuary in the United States. This 200-mile long river flows across six states and is home to millions of people and thousands of plant and animal species. Among those creatures is the unique diamondback terrapin.

Indian River Canoe TrailHiawatha National Forest, Michigan. In the upper peninsula of Michigan, check out the 51 mile-long Indian River, a Wild and Scenic River as of 1992. The canoe trail features canyon-like banks, sharp curves and broad marshland reaches. You'll be surrounded by northern hardwoods, mixed conifers and rolling hills.

Hawaii - The Big Island View 47 Photos Belongs on List? Yes No Glacier National Park #1 in Best Places to Hike in North America Glacier National Park offers more than 700 miles of hiking trails...

Kayak Camping Tips. Kayak camping is not all that different than backpacking - if anything it is easier as you don't have to carry all the weight on your back (unless you are portaging). Much of the same equipment you would use for backpacking also works for kayak camping - but with the added benefit that weight is not as much of an issue. This ...
